thread.title: Arsene Wenger "convinced" Alexis Sanchez will stay at Arsenal - but admits he could leave
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger "convinced" Alexis Sanchez will stay at Arsenal - but admits he could leave

author: Liam Corless
title: Arsene Wenger "convinced" Alexis Sanchez will stay at Arsenal - but admits he could leave
text:
Alexis Sanchez's future at Arsenal is far from certain (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Share Get Arsenal   
Arsene Wenger is "convinced" Alexis Sanchez will extend his Arsenal contract - but admits the Gunners won't pay over the odds to keep their star man. 
The Chilean's current deal is set to expire at the end of next season and his reaction to Arsenal's draw with Bournemouth on Tuesday prompted speculation he is unhappy at the club. 
However, Wenger told beIN SPORTS that Sanchez is content at the Emirates and committed to helping the north London club challenge for major honours. 
But the Frenchman says Arsenal will not break their wage structure to secure the former Barcelona man's long-term future. 
"It always starts with money, it finishes with money and in between the players want to stay or want to go," Wenger said. Sanchez was dejected at the end of Arsenal's 3-3 draw at Bournemouth (Photo: REUTERS) Sanchez couldn't hide his frustration at two dropped points (Photo: REUTERS) 
"When the players want to stay it's easier to find an agreement. We can certainly find an agreement. You cannot put the club in jeopardy as well for the players. 
"I think no matter what happens we'll try to keep them and we'll go as high as we can and if we cannot go further, we cannot go further. That's basically it. That's the way you have to manage a football club. 
"Alexis Sanchez is a committed player who wants to stay. I'm convinced we'll find an agreement. It has to be in our potential. Read More
